metadata.title: CVE-2020-10768 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel before 5.8-rc1 in the prctl()function, where it can be used to enable indirect branch speculation afterit has been disabled. This call incorrectly reports it as being 'forcedisabled' when it is not and opens the system to Spectre v2 attacks. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
